description: 1 x London plane (T15): 1.	Crown lift to 6.9m which requires target pruning of three primary limbs:a.	Primary limb approximately 240mm in diameter and approximately 5.5m in length at 5.09m from temporary ground level, situated at western aspect of T15, growing towards the Southwest aspect, target prune to main stem. (See para 3.1.1 of pruning specification and figure 4.2 (red line)) b.	Minor primary limb approximately 120mm in diameter and 4m in total length, 5.56 above ground level, extending towards North aspect, target prune to main stem.(See para 3.1.2 of pruning specification and figure 4.3 (blue line)) c.	Primary limb approximately 150mm in diameter, 5.5m in length at 5.73m above ground level to South aspect of T15, target prune to main stem. (See para 3.1.3 of pruning specification and figure 4.3 (yellow line))2.	Target prune to suitable branch union tertiary branches of less than 75mm growing towards ground below 6.5m height from ground level by no more than 1.5m. (See para 3.1.4 of pruning specification and figure 4.4 (pink lines)) 3.	Lateral crown reduction by 2m maximum to suitable branch junctions on south aspect of crown canopy, predominantly tertiary and secondary branches to create avenue of safe operation of heavy lift gantry crane. (See para 3.2 of pruning specification and figure 4.5 (approximate red line)).
